main.name: Toby Wolff-Maritz
main.description: I consult, modernise, and deliver tech solutions for the Public Sector.
main.bio: I'm a generalist technology professional who believes in using the right tools for the job. Throughout my 12 years in tech, I've worked across Aerospace, Retail, Finance, Law, Digital, and Defence. My journey started in IT Support then transitioned to leading brilliant Software teams building safety-critical systems.
main.contactmessage: Feel free to reach out to me here.

education.description: Earners of this certification have a comprehensive understanding of application life-cycle management. They demonstrated proficiency in writing applications with AWS service APIs, AWS CLI, and SDKs; using containers; and deploying with a CI/CD pipeline. Badge owners are able to develop, deploy, and debug cloud-based applications that follow AWS best practices.
Theory, design, development, and application of computers and computational systems

work.title: Senior Software Engineer
work.description: In Made Tech/DVLA blended teams on the Drivers First Provisional and Application Renewals projects.
work.skills: Tech: Ruby on Rails, React, NodeJS (shifting to Typescript), AWS, Serverless, Docker, K8s, Drone, PagerDuty, Instana, Report Portal, SonarQube

work.title: Software Engineer
work.description: Alongside the MoJ and other contractors as part of the Prison Transformation Program.

work.title: Software Project Lead
work.description: Many projects and positions ranging from Software Engineer to SPL (tech lead).
work.skills: Tech: C++, Python, C# (Unity), Tensorflow, Robot, Jenkins

projects.title: How to leverage continuous learning to deliver better services
projects.category: A webinar I presented for Made Tech.

projects.title: New Tab In Group
projects.category: A Chrome extension to open a new tab in the current group via keyboard shortcut.

testimonials.text: Here you should write some nice things that someone has said about you. No lies though, employers can tell when you are lying.

That Tim Baker must be one of the most brilliant developers I've ever met! It is amazing that nobody has hired him yet. Hey you, you should hire this guy, he may be fresh out of University and have zero on the job experience but I am confident that he will be one of your best developers in no time!
